result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob Allen Gilbert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
1) The defendant will have no further contacts w/law enforcement during term of agrmt. that give rise to probable cause for arrest due to criminal conduct.
2)Defendant shall notify Pepin County District Attorney's Office of any change of residence or employment.
3)One month prior to completion of contract, defendant must contact Pepin County District Attorney's Office for a final interview.
4)Report in person as requested by the Pepin County District Attorney or other supervisor designated by him.
5) The defendant must follow the rules and regulations as set forth by probation, if applicable.
ADDITIONAL CONDITIONS:
A.  Any violation of probation may be considered a violation of this agreement.  Specifically, a failed drug test will be considered a violation of this agreement.
B.  I will pay restitution in the amount of $1433.59 joint & severally with my codefendants.  I agree to pay $477.87 w/in the first year of this agreement to my probation agent.  The balance of restitution will be paid to Probation & Parole over the course of my probation as directed by Probation & Parole.
Pay restitution according to a schedule as set forth by Probation & Parole.

Provide a DNA sample;
Comply with any assessment or counseling as recommended by Probation & Parole;
Pay restitution in the amount of $1433.59 joint & severally with co-defendants.  Pay $477.87 within the first year of probation according to a schedule as set forth by Probation & Parole.
Comply with any assessment, counseling or treatment recommendations recommended by Probation & Parole.
Costs & DNA surcharge waived by the court.

timeConds.notes:
Serve 60 days in the Pepin County Jail with credit for 37 days served.  Work release privileges granted.
Concurrent with: Count 3

9 months in the Pepin County Jail with work release and release for counseling or treatment.  142 days credit.

Concurrent with: Count 3

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jacob Allen Gilbert in court with attorney Matthew James Krische.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court withholds sentence and places defendant on 3 yrs. probation. Conditions:  Pay unpaid restitution $1402.52; pay unpaid fine in 14CT10 within 6 mos. of probation; provide DNA sample; waive costs; comply with any assessment or counseling as recommended by probation & parole.  Advised of appeal rights.
Amended Order for PSI - line through Counts 2 & 3
DOC - Reason for Change:  Revoked - Sentenced to County Jail.
May serve in Trempealeau County if at no cost to Pepin County and without electronic monitoring.
records.descr: Amended Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt: Approved by court.  Allow service in Trempealeau Co. if without cost and without electronic monitoring.
DA's response, no objection to Atty Krische's request.
Letter from Atty Krische requesting defendant be allowed to serve his sentence in Tremp. Co. Jail as long as it is of no cost to Pepin County.
Sentencing hearing at 04-20-2015 09:00 am

Defendant Jacob Allen Gilbert in court with attorney Matthew James Krische.  Defendant Jacob Allen Gilbert in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State recommends 6 mos. concurrent.  Atty Krische in agrmt. with P&P agent's recommendation.  Court sentences defendant to 9 months in the Pepin County Jail with credit for 142 days served, concurrent with eachother.  Grant judgment for unpaid court ordered obs.  Advised of appeal rights.  Referred to scheduling clerk for sentencing on Count 1.

Defendant Jacob Allen Gilbert in court with attorney Matthew James Krische.  Defendant Jacob Allen Gilbert in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  2 matters before the Court.  Motion to Revoke DPA & Sentence After Revocation.  Defendant does not dispute the Motion to Revoke.  Court grants Motion, accepts plea in 14CF24, finds defendant guilty.  PSI ordered.
Motion hearing on February 17, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Motion to Revoke Deferred Acceptance of Guilty or No Contest Plea Agreement.
Atty Matthew Krische appt'd.
Deferred Acceptance of Guilty Plea Agreement.

Defendant Jacob Allen Gilbert in court with attorney Haley B Wright.  Defendant Jacob Allen Gilbert in custody.  Jon D Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel informs the court of plea negotiations.  Defendant waives right to Prelim. Hrg. in 14CF24.  Waiver form filed with court.  Court finds defendant's waiver of P.H. done K&V, accepts Information for filing.   Judge advises defendant of charges/max. penalties and constitutional rights.  Advises defendant of felony conviction penalties.  Advises defendant of OAR OWI related in 14CT10.  Defendant enters plea of guilty to Count 1 in 14CT10, Counts 2 & 3 in 14CF24, subject to DPA in Count 1 in 14CF24, enters a plea of guilty.  PLQ/WRF filed.  Court finds defendant's waiver of his constitutional rights & plea done K&V, accepts pleas in 14CT10 and 14CF24 Cts. 2 & 3, defers acceptance of GP in 14CF24 Count 1.  14CT10 assess fine/costs $516 TTP granted.  14CF24 Cts 2&3 w/hold sentence and place on 2 yrs. probation with conditions.  Appeal rights given.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jacob Allen Gilbert in court with attorney Haley B Wright.  Defendant Jacob Allen Gilbert in custody.  Jon D Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives time limits for P.H.  Atty Wright requests bond modification for defendant to reside with his parents.  State opposes.  Atty Wright asks the Court to consider a reduced bond amount.  Court continues bond as previously set.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 17, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Atty Haley Wright appt'd.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jacob Allen Gilbert in court, in custody.  Jon D Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Judge advises defendant of charges/max. penalties and rights including right to Prelim.  State requests $1000 cash bond with conditions:  No contact with Ace Hardware, Countryside Coop.; No contact with co-defendants.  Court sets $1000 Cash Bond with conditions:  No contact with Ace Hardware or Countryside Coop.; No contact with Michael Brantner or Benjamin Ross.  Defendant wishes to contact an Atty.  Court notes waiver of time limits.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 20, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
